settings.text:
All: Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world,
have mercy on us.
Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world,
have mercy on us.
Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world,
grant us peace.
During the breaking of the host the following is sung or said:
Lamb of God
All: And with your spirit.
Priest: The peace of the Lord be with you always.
All: Amen.

Priest: Lord Jesus Christ,
who said to your Apostles:
Peace I leave you, my peace I give you,
look not on our sins,
but on the faith of your Church,
and graciously grant her peace and unity
in accordance with your will.
Who live and reign for ever and ever.
Sign of Peace

All: For the kingdom,
the power and the glory are yours
now and for ever.

Priest: Deliver us, Lord, we pray, from every evil,
graciously grant peace in our days,
that, by the help of your mercy,
we may be always free from sin
and safe from all distress,
as we await the blessed hope
and the coming of our Saviour, Jesus Christ.

Priest: At the Saviours command
and formed by divine teaching, we dare to say:
(Stand)
All: Amen!

Priest: Through him, and with him, and in him,
O God, almighty Father,
in the unity of the Holy Spirit,
all glory and honour is yours,
for ever and ever.
The Great Amen
The Mystery of Faith
Priest: The mystery of faith.

All: When we eat this Bread and drink this Cup,
we proclaim your Death, O Lord,
until you come again.
(Kneel)

All: Holy, Holy, Holy Lord God of hosts.
Heaven and earth are full of your glory.
Hosanna in the highest.
Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.
Hosanna in the highest.

Priest: ...And so, with Angels and Archangels,
with Thrones and Dominions,
and with all the hosts and Powers of heaven,
we sing the hymn of your glory,
as without end we acclaim:
Holy, Holy, Holy

and graciously appears to them in the ways,
and meets them with all solicitude.
R. Glory to you, O Lord.
A reading from the Gospel according to Matthew.
R. And with your Spirit
The Lord be with you.

I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the holy catholic Church,
the communion of saints,
the forgiveness of sins,
the resurrection of the body,
and life everlasting. Amen.
Apostle's Creed
The Gospel of the Lord

sources.name: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

settings.text: R: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

At midnight, there was a cry,
Behold, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!
Then all those virgins got up and trimmed their lamps. 
The foolish ones said to the wise,
Give us some of your oil,
for our lamps are going out.
But the wise ones replied,
'No, for there may not be enough for us and you.
Go instead to the merchants and buy some for yourselves.
While they went off to buy it,
the bridegroom came
and those who were ready went into the wedding feast with him. 
Then the door was locked.
Gospel
Alleluia

Jesus told his disciples this parable:
"The kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins
who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom. 
Five of them were foolish and five were wise. 
The foolish ones, when taking their lamps,
brought no oil with them,
but the wise brought flasks of oil with their lamps. 
Since the bridegroom was long delayed,
they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

Stay awake and be ready!
For you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
R. Alleluia, alleluia.

Thus will I bless you while I live;
lifting up my hands, I will call upon your name.
As with the riches of a banquet shall my soul be satisfied,
and with exultant lips my mouth shall praise you.
R. My soul is thirsting for you, O Lord my God.

Along with this livestream Mass, we are celebrating Mass in church with New York States requirement of limited capacity and social distancing.  

Be sure to check our facebook page, your emails and the parish office phone message for any updates.

Weekday Masses are being celebrated at 8:30 a.m. Monday through Friday without reservations.

Today's readings are:
WIS 6:12-16
1 THES 4:13-14
MT 25:1-13

St. Theodore's Church
Thirty-second Sunday
in Ordinary Time
November 8, 2020 9:00am

My Jesus, 
I believe that You are present in the Most Holy Sacrament. 
I love You above all things, 
and I desire to receive You into my soul. 
Since I cannot at this moment receive You sacramentally, 
come at least spiritually into my heart. 
I embrace You as if You were already there 
and unite myself wholly to You. 
Never permit me to be separated from You.

Amen.

Thank you for attending
May God bless you

Resplendent and unfading is wisdom,
and she is readily perceived by those who love her,
and found by those who seek her.
She hastens to make herself known in anticipation of their desire;
Whoever watches for her at dawn shall not be disappointed,
for he shall find her sitting by his gate.
For taking thought of wisdom is the perfection of prudence,
and whoever for her sake keeps vigil
shall quickly be free from care;
because she makes her own rounds, seeking those worthy of her,
Reading 1
The Word of the Lord
R: Thanks Be to God
Responsorial Psalm

We do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters,
about those who have fallen asleep,
so that you may not grieve like the rest, who have no hope. 
For if we believe that Jesus died and rose,
so too will God, through Jesus,
bring with him those who have fallen asleep. 
Indeed, we tell you this, on the word of the Lord,
that we who are alive,
who are left until the coming of the Lord,
Reading 2

Glory to God in the highest,
and on earth peace to people of good will.

We praise you,
we bless you,
we adore you,
we glorify you,
we give you thanks for your great glory,
Lord God, heavenly King,
O God, almighty Father.

Lord Jesus Christ, Only Begotten Son,
Lord God, Lamb of God, Son of the Father,
you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us;
you take away the sins of the world,
Gloria

receive our prayer;
you are seated at the right hand of the Father, have mercy on us.

For you alone are the Holy One,
you alone are the Lord,
you alone are the Most High,
Jesus Christ,
with the Holy Spirit,
in the glory of God the Father. Amen.
Nicene Creed

I believe in one God,
the Father almighty,
maker of heaven and earth,
of all things visible and invisible.

I believe in one Lord Jesus Christ,
the Only Begotten Son of God,
born of the Father before all ages.
God from God, Light from Light,
true God from true God,
begotten, not made, consubstantial with the Father;
through him all things were made.
For us men and for our salvation
he came down from heaven,
(Bow) and by the Holy Spirit was incarnate of the Virgin Mary,
and became man. (End Bow)

For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate,
he suffered death and was buried,
and rose again on the third day
in accordance with the Scriptures.
He ascended into heaven
and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
He will come again in glory
to judge the living and the dead
and his kingdom will have no end.

I believe in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son,
who with the Father and the Son is adored and glorified,
who has spoken through the prophets.

I believe in one, holy, catholic and apostolic Church.
I confess one Baptism for the forgiveness of sins
and I look forward to the resurrection of the dead
and the life of the world to come. Amen.

Celebrate the holiday season by remembering or honoring a special person, with a light on St. Theodores Lights of Love Tree.  A contribution of $5 will illuminate one of the lights on the Lights of Love Tree. The lights will shine brightly every night from December 5, 2020 to January 3, 2021, the Feast of the Epiphany.  Forms are in this weeks bulletin and available in the back of church or parish office. All forms need to be in by Monday, November 23.

Its still not too late to get your SOS Daily Cash Raffle tickets.  They can be picked up in the church entrance and in the parish office during office hours.

The Rite of Christian Initiation of Adults and the Rite of Christian Initiation of Children offers those who have never been baptized - or who were baptized in another Christian denomination - or who were baptized Catholic but never received First Eucharist and Confirmation just that opportunity. To find out more, call the office at 429-6811.
Confiteor

I confess to almighty God
and to you, my brothers and sisters,
that I have greatly sinned
in my thoughts and in my words,
in what I have done
and in what I have failed to do,
(striking breast)
through my fault,
through my fault,
through my most grievous fault;
therefore I ask blessed Mary ever-Virgin,
all the Angels and Saints,
and you, my brothers and sisters,
to pray for me to the Lord our God.
Our Father
Invitation to Communion

Priest: Behold the Lamb of God,
behold him who takes away the sins of the world.
Blessed are those called to the supper of the Lamb.

All:  Lord, I am not worthy
that you should enter under my roof,
but only say the word
and my soul shall be healed.

Thus have I gazed toward you in the sanctuary
to see your power and your glory,
For your kindness is a greater good than life;
my lips shall glorify you.

(Stand)
Priest: Pray, brothers and sisters,
that my sacrifice and yours
may be acceptable to God,
the almighty Father.
The Offertory

All: May the Lord accept the sacrifice at your hands
for the praise and glory of his name,
for our good
and the good of all his holy Church.

We are grateful to everyone who have kept their weekly offerings current and pray that you continue to do so.  In order for us to resume our ministries and programs upon reopening, we need everyone to contribute to our Sunday offering.
 
Sunday envelopes and food donations can be dropped off outside the parish life center on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays from 9-12.    The food cupboard is open and in need of donations.  Please check our bulletin for the needed item of the week.  

Please do not drop off bottles/cans until further notice.

Theos Closet is closed until further notice.  Clothing donations made be put in the St. Pauly Shed in the back parking lot.  

Please be sure to let your family, friends and neighbors know that Masses have resumed since we are unable to contact everyone individually.  Please call the office at 429-6811 for more information.

will surely not precede those who have fallen asleep.
For the Lord himself, with a word of command,
with the voice of an archangel and with the trumpet of God,
will come down from heaven,
and the dead in Christ will rise first. 
Then we who are alive, who are left,
will be caught up together with them in the clouds
to meet the Lord in the air. 
Thus we shall always be with the Lord. 
Therefore, console one another with these words.

I will remember you upon my couch,
and through the night-watches I will meditate on you:
You are my help,
and in the shadow of your wings I shout for joy.

items.name: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

settings.text:
Afterwards the other virgins came and said,
Lord, Lord, open the door for us!
But he said in reply,
Amen, I say to you, I do not know you.
Therefore, stay awake,
for you know neither the day nor the hour."

We do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters,
about those who have fallen asleep,
so that you may not grieve like the rest, who have no hope. 
For if we believe that Jesus died and rose,
so too will God, through Jesus,
bring with him those who have fallen asleep.
